ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a different way of approaching math, logic and computer science. Learning about these topics, in the way that they are presented in the course, forced me to think in a more granular way. I think that this is very unique and I enjoyed it immensely.
Some mathematical and computer science logic thinkings.
This course has provided me with an understanding of various mathematical concepts related to computers, along with their practical applications.
math proofs
The math logic of computer science coding, sometimes the problems in Psets are pretty tricky, so I think I also get the skill of analyzing a problem form  different perspectives.
Graph theory, set theory, and also strengthened my proof skills, graph theory and set theory have already proven to be useful in my academic career.
Systematic knowledge of discrete mathematics and a first-step grasp of computer mathematics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Because it is a summer course, the material is presented very quickly in class. Class time is mostly devoted to establishing definitions and a few quick practice problems and most of my intuition for problems was built through working through the problem sets. I think this could be either a strength or weakness of the course depending on the student.

The pace of the earlier course sections is managed quite well. The abundance of office hours was also highly beneficial, as both the professors and teaching assistants were patient in addressing inquiries. There was a strong sense of engagement in the classroom. One possible suggestion, as we progressed to the later sections of the course, the pace accelerated and the material became more extensive and diverse, it is a little bit hard to catch up.
The material is clear

The homework assignments were nearly impossible to do with only the knowledge provided in the lessons and textbook. The lessons were confusing and the professor often made mistakes or didn't know how to explain a topic. The TAs were better equipped to teach the class and often had to interrupt the professor to correct him or explain something in an understandable way.
More TA office hours, walkthrough of pset type questions in class would be very helpful too

Strengths: lots of knowledge condensed into a short period of time, I found that I learned at a much higher pace than any other course Ive attended
Weaknesses: quizzes were considerably easier than question sets, which I found a lot of difficulties in doing.
I think this course is wonderful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: The logic required for proofs and the satisfaction felt after completing a particularly hard problem were definitely the high-points of the class for me. I would absolutely recommend other students to take the course. The material was interesting, the grading was fair and the professor and TA's were great!
I would recommend this course to the people who has some basic understanding of CS.
Yes! This course is engaging, and both the professors and teaching assistants patiently provide assistance, enabling a solid grasp of the relevant knowledge.
yes

No I would not. Regardless of how many office hours I attended I simply could not understand the concepts presented in class. I feel that the professor was not prepared to teach this course. There were some concepts that I already understood prior to taking this class that he taught in this course. If I did not already have a background understanding of those concepts, I do not think I would have been able to understand them at all based on his explanation of them.
Yes, because it could truly improve our skill a lot, I think it would be especially useful if students want to dig deeper into computer science field.

I believe the TAs were extremely helpful and the Professor was extremely accommodating, just that the material was quite challenging and I would suggest only taking this class during the summer if you have LOTS of time to devote to this class
Yes, for beginners to set theory, this course was very helpful in understanding this important segment of mathematics
Yes. It is an excellent course and you will meet a lot of interesting people.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: The course definitely grew my interest in both CS and math. I think that down-the-line I will take a more courses in these topics.
I think i would use it a lot since i want to do some Bio Information field jobs or researches so it would definitely bevery useful.
If I intend to further develop in the field of computer science in the future, this course has provided me with a solid mathematical foundation.
algorithms
I think its really great for me as I want to study computer science and machine learning in the future, and this course certainly ground my math base.
I will use this knowledge to further my study of Computer Science.
